course_description: Introduces the study of music as historical and cultural practice. Considers essential repertoires of vernacular and art music in Western and non-Western traditions. Teaches foundational skills needed to research and write critically about musical cultures, repertoires, and practices.
sections: Class Nbr: 4536, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: M. McNeill, Status: Open
